page.title: 17CHILDREN OF S.ELKINGTON
page.content: Number of children in S.Elkington aged 0-16yrs.approx.35,1/6th of the population of the area.The village school closed in 1982,and children are taken daily by bus to Louth,collected along the main road.A group of under five year olds meet fortnightly in a large house,and some go to play groups in Louth.Some older children join Cub Scouts,Army Cadets,bell ringing or St. James's Church choir, but their main interests centre mainly on the country side.These include:- caring for farm animals and chickens,gardening,cooking nature study,den-making in the woods, pony riding,fishing,game shooting,golf cycling,tennis,swimming,knitting,chess playing the recorder and piano,acting, reading,sewing,collecting car models. Many children owned pets.These were a goose,budgerigar,pony,rabbits, but the most popular pet was a dog.
